channel.title: Latent Profile Analysis on Will Hipson
channel.description: Recent content in Latent Profile Analysis on Will Hipson

item.title: Quick Example of Latent Profile Analysis in R
item.description: Latent Profile Analysis (LPA) tries to identify clusters of individuals (i.e., latent profiles) based on responses to a series of continuous variables (i.e., indicators). LPA assumes that there are unobserved latent profiles that generate patterns of responses on indicator items. Here, I will go through a quick example of LPA to identify groups of people based on their interests/hobbies. The data comes from the Young People Survey, available freely on Kaggle.
